topics.body:
So like the idiot I am, I wanted to watch some - *ahem* - pleasuring things, and the first thing I thought of was Boku no Pico, because a) it really isn't as bad as people say and b) decent animation.

I got to the first scene where he's rubbing ice on his nips and lost my shit from there on in. There was no pleasuring involved.

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/52d360e56368722fa54a0000#post_52d360e56368722fa54a0000

If you look at it from a psychological perspective, Pico's relationship with the man is actually somewhat terrifying, not simply because of its nature, but because the anime doesn't glorify nor look down upon the relationship, _it merely shows it._ The end where his big blue eyes stare into the distance as he whispers "I love you" make this even worse.

Of course, this is looking too deeply into it. It an introduction into the world of loli for most people, nothing else.

topics.body:
Speaking of shows; what shows(doesn't just have to include anime) have you recently gotten into?

I found out about K-On!  It's cute and I understand why it was so popular.  If they do make a season based off from after they graduate high school I *REALLY* hope they don't follow the manga though.


Also finished up yozakura quartet.  I'm a S-Rank all day sucker for supernatural tv shows(including supernatural) and a double sucker for shows with youkai and supernatural "monsters" in them.  Personally I like how they're developing the hunter arcs into their own ovas not dependent on the series.  Like the one about the necromancer wanting to "protect" her zombie friend is technically a part of the first series, but fits with either one.   I don't know if they'll continue the show or not, but they haven't gotten past the current story arc so I'll be a while until they get back on track.  Basically main show is on hiatus and making the current arcs into ovas, cause they're making they're not done with the story yet in the manga.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
